name: Nathan Bird
headline: Software Dev Intern @ ICS, Church of Jesus Christ
about:
I'm a recently-graduated Software Engineer from BYU–Idaho with hands-on experience in Java, C++, and the Microsoft Power Platform (Apps, Pages, Automate, BI, custom JS web-resources).
I currently work as a Software Developer Intern for the Information and Communication Services (ICS) department of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, where I'm part of a team that maintains Dynamics 365 software infrastructure for BYU-Pathway Worldwide. Previously, I interned as a Backend Web Developer at FamilySearch, where I developed a large-scale web crawler for a Paris 2024 Olympics genealogical campaign and maintained REST API microservices in Java Springboot. During my undergrad, I also worked as a programming tutor and research assistant, mentoring peers and contributing to mobile app development research for my university.
I'm highly adaptable and love to learn; I especially enjoy working on personal programming projects that allow me to explore new technologies and expand my technical breadth. Outside of tech, I enjoy board games, playing piano, choral singing, and editorial writing.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering
activities: Awarded full-ride BYU–Idaho Scholarship for academic excellence

experience.title: Software Developer Intern
experience.company: ICS, Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
bullets: Engineered a bespoke, filterable, force-directed entity-relationship visualization of 2,510+ Dataverse tables in Power BI, enabling teams to navigate complex data models far beyond the capabilities of out-of-box documentation tools

Automate documentation for 5,000+ Power Automate flows by designing a pipeline that integrates Azure AI with the Power Platform Center of Excellence, transforming a manual, months-long process into a scalable, intelligent catalog
Enhance multilingual support within the BYU–Pathway Worldwide Help Center, implementing the groundwork for global student accessibility and driving adoption in non-English speaking regions
Extend Dynamics 365 CRM with custom JavaScript web resources to unlock advanced customizations unavailable through native Power Apps, empowering stakeholders with tailored functionality

experience.title: Programming Tutor
bullets: Mentored 40+ students across 8 university courses over 5 semesters, analyzing and critiquing ~75K lines of code

Facilitated 100+ sessions covering software design principles in Python, C, C++, SQL, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, creating custom walkthroughs from prior high-scoring coursework to reinforce key concepts
Troubleshooted code involving drag force, Mach number, gravity at altitude, and linear interpolation for students in a notorious C++ physics simulation course

Demonstrated technical mastery and strong communication—one student sought guidance through 3 advanced successive courses and offered private compensation over free university alternatives after official role ended

experience.title: Backend Developer Intern
bullets: Selected for 1 of only 2 backend intern roles from a pool of 30+ web/QA candidates
Exceeded expectations and trusted to write 2K+ lines of production code typically reserved for full-time engineers
Developed and maintained 7 REST APIs and microservices in Java Spring Boot

Devised and deployed a web crawler that ran for 9 hours overnight gathering data on 65K+ Olympians for a 2024 Paris Olympics initiative, directly enabling Olympic content search capabilities for the site
Authored 700+ unit/integration tests with Spring Boot and Mockito, increasing coverage to 95%+ across 7 services

experience.title: Research Assistant
bullets: Constructed ~15K lines of Angular Ionic code across 150 files as part of a comparative study on 5 mobile app platforms
Evaluated setup, learning curve, and maintainability by developing a full mobile app with 114 commits over 3 months
Diagnosed persistent incompatibilities between AWS Amplify and Angular, leading to a migration to Firebase
Synthesized findings across 15 key metrics, including build complexity, documentation quality, and dev efficiency, contributing to a 20-page technical report

experience.title: Software Consultant
bullets: Designed and delivered 4 custom Python-based solutions totaling 3K+ lines of code and 130 commits, spanning GUI development, image metadata tools, facial tracking via OpenCV, and SQL-based file management systems
Built a 3D scene renderer independently from scratch with only NumPy and OpenCV to visualize facial tracking data—an unrequested tool which impressed the client and enhanced calibration accuracy
